commit_message:
Refactor and decompose db_base_plugin_v2.py

- Rebased to the master branch to get the latest fix on tox.ini
  This resolves "ConfigError: substitution key 'envbindir' not found" error
  when running functional testing.
- Added infoblox and openstack license info in the comment section.
- Changed variable names that use camel cases to use low cases with
  underscores in BaseRequestFactory.

Change-Id: Ic8c6484ac13544c91b9ca537c96a5518dfd7fdf2
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-ipam

VMware: add support for NFS 4.1

ESX 6.0 supports NFS 4.1. This patch enables NFS 4.1 support.

Closes-bug: #1451834

DocImpact: The driver will now support NFS version 4.1

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-18 21:22:59.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/deployment_serializers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_cluster_changes_handler.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_orchestrator_serializer.py'], 'message': 'Add controller to deployment critical roles list

Currently if a failure happens on a controller as part of an HA
deployment, the failure is ignored and the deployment continues on the
rest of the nodes. This can lead to errors in the post deployment
phase. One particular instance is when Ceph is being utilized and
we attempt to restart the rados processes on all of the controllers.

In order to prevent errors that may occur in the post deployment
phase, we need to ensure that all actions were successful on all of
the regular controller nodes as well as the primary-controller role.

Change-Id: I466c9f13f373d9a7a5e05e365c173895c87a56a2
Closes-Bug: 1456318
Related-Bug: 1455570
'}]
commit_message:
Add controller to deployment critical roles list

Currently if a failure happens on a controller as part of an HA
deployment, the failure is ignored and the deployment continues on the
rest of the nodes. This can lead to errors in the post deployment
phase. One particular instance is when Ceph is being utilized and
we attempt to restart the rados processes on all of the controllers.

In order to prevent errors that may occur in the post deployment
phase, we need to ensure that all actions were successful on all of
the regular controller nodes as well as the primary-controller role.

Change-Id: I466c9f13f373d9a7a5e05e365c173895c87a56a2
Closes-Bug: 1456318
Related-Bug: 1455570

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-05-19 00:56:45.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/l23network/spec/classes/network_scheme__adjust_mtu__spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/l23network/lib/puppetx/l23_network_scheme.rb', 'deployment/puppet/l23network/spec/functions/get_network_role_property__phys_dev__spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/l23network/lib/puppet/parser/functions/get_network_role_property.rb', 'deployment/puppet/l23network/lib/puppet/parser/functions/generate_network_config.rb', 'deployment/puppet/l23network/lib/puppet/parser/functions/get_transformation_property.rb'], 'message': "Adjust MTU for child interfaces if it possible

For network scheme, like
---

  version: 1.1

  transformations:
    - action: add-port
      name: eth1

Change-Id: I170e9088d5e3bcd241da7e56dfa7b7934d6d810d

commit_message:
Adjust MTU for child interfaces if it possible

For network scheme, like
---
network_scheme:
  version: 1.1
  provider: lnx
  interfaces:
    eth1:
      mtu: 9000
  transformations:
    - action: add-port
      name: eth1
    - action: add-port
      name: eth1.101
  endpoints:
    eth1.101:
      IP:
        - 192.168.34.56/24
  roles:
    xxx: eth1.101

interface 'eth1.101' should be created with MTU=9000

Closes-bug: #1453027
Change-Id: I170e9088d5e3bcd241da7e56dfa7b7934d6d810d

commit_message:
Replace dict.itervalues() with six.itervalues(dict)

The Python 2 itervalues() method of dictionaries was renamed to values()
in Python 3. Replace dict.itervalues() with six.itervalues(dict) to get
code working on Python 2 and Python 3.

This patch was generated by the following tool (revision fcbf8ad0ec7a)
with the "itervalues" operation:
https://bitbucket.org/haypo/misc/src/tip/python/sixer.py

Blueprint nova-python3
Change-Id: Ied9a76447fbdc933369f926cb19aab9d8896ab92

revisions:

Change-Id: I38ca49d8685121f04ed9b8cebaecea230b7713dc
'}]
commit_message:
Python 3: sort tables by their full name

Sort SQLAlchemy tables by their full names using a key functions when
calling sorted(tables).

On Python 3, sqlalchemy.Table instances are no more comparable.

Change-Id: I38ca49d8685121f04ed9b8cebaecea230b7713dc

commit_message:
Python 3: replace long with int

* Replace 123L with 123: "123L" is a syntax error on Python 3
* Replace long() with int()
* Replace (int, long) with six.integer_types
* Make long type conditional in META_TYPE_MAP
  (ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/utils.py)

Change-Id: Iccd628222b63caf4ff9bbab17f973b7da1f370bb

"}]
commit_message:
Removing sleep between when a command is sent and 'YES' is sent

Removing sleep between when a command is sent and 'YES' is sent to
confirm the operation. We believe it is added because the Cisco CLI
is mirrored based on Brocade. Removing would increase performance when
launching concurrent vms.

Closes-Bug: #1447776

Change-Id: I3102922456fa9dde3a63ec623565a3427e9b357d

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

commit_message:
keystone_service resource using api Version 3

  - Uses _type_, not the _name_ for resource creation
  - OSC Service list does not use the --long argument
  - Destroy and update (set) now uses resource ID rather its name.
  - Offers backward compatibility as much as possible.

Change-Id: Iea277a518d11ecf1ba2d80769e9c02699a90ac40
Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-24 11:46:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py'], 'message': 'Set conductor use_local flag in compute manager tests

Some compute manager tests that exercise the exception behavior of
methods combined with using a somewhat real instance parameter when
doing so take very long time to complete(>60s). This happens if the
method being tested has the @revert_task_state decorator because it
will try to update the instance using a conductor call when there is
no conductor service listening.

By setting the use_local flag, these tests no longer experience such
timeouts and total test time is reduced by minutes.

Change-Id: I4f5272f5b39d53ad7e868cc8c91a793851ab4387
Closes-Bug: #1435803
'}]
commit_message:
Set conductor use_local flag in compute manager tests

Some compute manager tests that exercise the exception behavior of
methods combined with using a somewhat real instance parameter when
doing so take very long time to complete(>60s). This happens if the
method being tested has the @revert_task_state decorator because it
will try to update the instance using a conductor call when there is
no conductor service listening.

By setting the use_local flag, these tests no longer experience such
timeouts and total test time is reduced by minutes.

Change-Id: I4f5272f5b39d53ad7e868cc8c91a793851ab4387
Closes-Bug: #1435803

commit_message:
Adapt hadoop-hdp element to dib-lint checks

- Remove tez package from this script, because it not exist in Hortonworks repository
- Add -e flag, and now it not trigger any dib-lint error

Closes-Bug: #1450509
Partial-Bug: #1435306

Change-Id: I1a09a727549416bd93f1463ad744b8bd03aa4452

flake8 requires pbr < 1.0, whereas nova installs pbr 1.0.

Closes-Bug: #1456362
Depends-On: I4481b03f282e2092e259caa3599e5f773f7ee9af

'}]
commit_message:
Restrict pbr to version < 1.0

pbr 1.0 was released. The release broke the nova pep8 gate because
flake8 requires pbr < 1.0, whereas nova installs pbr 1.0.

Closes-Bug: #1456362
Depends-On: I4481b03f282e2092e259caa3599e5f773f7ee9af
Change-Id: I2aaf8af57ab59047bc34611a3baa00305238c98f

Make hacking-python34 gating

python 3 compatibility, so make it voting.

Python3 jobs template already includes the python34 unit test job.

subject: support for keystone v3 api - allow v2 or v3 providers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-18 06:15:13.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/keystone.rb'], 'message': "support for keystone v3 api - allow v2 or v3 providers

- This patch implements blueprint part 1)

  Using Puppet::Provider::Openstack::API object to create a class variable
  allowing providers supporting v3 to override the class variable with '3' value

  Default is API Version 2.0:
  @api = Puppet::Provider::Openstack::API.new('2.0')

Change-Id: I6cd6a3a5bd206bc4495ab1b7c236c7e3fbd11f4a
Implements: blueprint api-v3-support
"}]
commit_message:
support for keystone v3 api - allow v2 or v3 providers

- This patch implements blueprint part 1)

  Using Puppet::Provider::Openstack::API object to create a class variable
  allowing providers supporting v3 to override the class variable with '3' value

  Default is API Version 2.0:
  @api = Puppet::Provider::Openstack::API.new('2.0')

Change-Id: I6cd6a3a5bd206bc4495ab1b7c236c7e3fbd11f4a
Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

commit_message:
Refactor and decompose db_base_plugin_v2.py

- Rebased to the master branch to get the latest fix on tox.ini
  This resolves "ConfigError: substitution key 'envbindir' not found" error
  when running functional testing.
- Added infoblox and openstack license info in the comment section.
- Changed variable names that use camel cases to use low cases with
  underscores in BaseRequestFactory.

Change-Id: I1096568456fe306a0d0714405d4b10bb4c370f59

subject: Fix a bug in cluster test case
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-19 03:54:17.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/test_cluster.py'], 'message': "Fix a bug in cluster test case

Sometimes, the *os.heat.stack* profile can't be registered correctly
when EngineService is initialized. This error happened occasionally
when doing test case. This patch temporarily replaces usage of
*os.heat.stack* profile type in cluster test cases with a fake
profile type to prevent this bug happening since it's now blocking
all verifications.

TODO:
 - Need to check the detail reason of this bug later.

Change-Id: I1d3b49001bd1cc8b0be5f91b87ae2f726d4cead4
Closes-Bug: #1452604
"}]
commit_message:
Fix a bug in cluster test case

Sometimes, the *os.heat.stack* profile can't be registered correctly
when EngineService is initialized. This error happened occasionally
when doing test case. This patch temporarily replaces usage of
*os.heat.stack* profile type in cluster test cases with a fake
profile type to prevent this bug happening since it's now blocking
all verifications.

TODO:
 - Need to check the detail reason of this bug later.

Change-Id: I1d3b49001bd1cc8b0be5f91b87ae2f726d4cead4
Closes-Bug: #1452604

subject: Bump pbr cap to <2.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-19 00:32:07.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': "Bump pbr cap to <2.0

Hacking's pbr cap of <1.0 is breaking things (see bug for a lot more
detail). Trunk hacking has already moved to the new pbr cap, but it
there is a backwards incompatible change on trunk
(I819d2069f169cabd1fcf333057a80790678e3745) that prevents us from
releasing 0.10.2 from there. So I created a 0.10.x branch and am
changing the pbr requirement here so that we can cut hacking 0.10.2 to
fix the bug.

Change-Id: I77f2b7e661c4de067e39596765d36a4463a2d143
Closes-Bug: #1456376
"}]
commit_message:
Bump pbr cap to <2.0

Hacking's pbr cap of <1.0 is breaking things (see bug for a lot more
detail). Trunk hacking has already moved to the new pbr cap, but it
there is a backwards incompatible change on trunk
(I819d2069f169cabd1fcf333057a80790678e3745) that prevents us from
releasing 0.10.2 from there. So I created a 0.10.x branch and am
changing the pbr requirement here so that we can cut hacking 0.10.2 to
fix the bug.

Change-Id: I77f2b7e661c4de067e39596765d36a4463a2d143
Closes-Bug: #1456376

commit_message:
Bug 1456376: Lock pbr < 1.0 for now

See the bug for details, but flake8 is doing runtime checks for
co-installability, and this fails as many projects still have a pbr
<1.0 install_requires: but g-r controls the versions installed due to
pip bug 988.

Change-Id: I4481b03f282e2092e259caa3599e5f773f7ee9af
Partial-Bug: 1456376

subject: Bump pbr versions.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-18 21:36:10.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Bump pbr versions.

We're about to release pbr 1.0. This needs to be permitted :). Also
anything < 0.10 was totally broken with PEP-440 in pip, so we have
to bump the lower end. Since we're bumping it, bring everything in
line with the current release - which we gate on everywere anyway

"}]
commit_message:
Bump pbr versions.

We're about to release pbr 1.0. This needs to be permitted :). Also
anything < 0.10 was totally broken with PEP-440 in pip, so we have
to bump the lower end. Since we're bumping it, bring everything in
line with the current release - which we gate on everywere anyway
because setup_requires is unversioned.

Change-Id: Ia7205b4599ae648cdb4935111458d92f2065b47e

subject: Add vagrant nodeset and make it the default
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-08 21:05:45.000000000', 'files': ['spec/acceptance/nodesets/default.yml', 'spec/acceptance/nodesets/ubuntu-server-1404-x64.yml', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Add vagrant nodeset and make it the default

Added an Ubuntu nodeset stolen from the puppetlabs apache module.
The box_url is necessary even though the box is namespaced, vagrant
seems to have changed recently and just having the vagrant cloud
namespace in the box name is not enough to import the box.

We're making this nodeset the default so that a developer can have
it "just work" on their laptop. CI will be configured to use a
nodepool nodeset. Following the example of the puppetlabs modules,
the default nodeset is a copy of the new ubuntu nodeset so that
setting BEAKER_set=ubuntu-server-1404-x64 still works.

Fixed an error in the README (correct environment variable is
BEAKER_set not BEAKER_setfile) and added more details.

Change-Id: Ib3e50ffbaf613dd2e6582904efeff1d7cce77bb5
'}]
commit_message:
Add vagrant nodeset and make it the default

Added an Ubuntu nodeset stolen from the puppetlabs apache module.
The box_url is necessary even though the box is namespaced, vagrant
seems to have changed recently and just having the vagrant cloud
namespace in the box name is not enough to import the box.

We're making this nodeset the default so that a developer can have
it "just work" on their laptop. CI will be configured to use a
nodepool nodeset. Following the example of the puppetlabs modules,
the default nodeset is a copy of the new ubuntu nodeset so that
setting BEAKER_set=ubuntu-server-1404-x64 still works.

Fixed an error in the README (correct environment variable is
BEAKER_set not BEAKER_setfile) and added more details.

Change-Id: Ib3e50ffbaf613dd2e6582904efeff1d7cce77bb5

subject: Allow libvirt secret key setting from param
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-04 02:14:49.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/compute/rbd.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_compute_rbd_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Allow libvirt secret key setting from param

Currently the libvirt secret key is demanded to the ceph cluster
via the $(ceph auth get-key ...) command which requires the ceph
cluste to be already up and also assumes the computes are provisioned
with the client.admin keyring.

With this change we add a libvirt_rbd_secret_key parameter which,
if passed, is used instead so that computes can be configured
without the distribution of additional keys.

Change-Id: I70da06159c0d3c6fa204b5f7a468909ffab4d633
Closes-Bug: #1439949
(cherry picked from commit a8ba5a41cdbcbc5b4123cc97e0e46f4c7702b8fa)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow libvirt secret key setting from param

Currently the libvirt secret key is demanded to the ceph cluster
via the $(ceph auth get-key ...) command which requires the ceph
cluste to be already up and also assumes the computes are provisioned
with the client.admin keyring.

With this change we add a libvirt_rbd_secret_key parameter which,
if passed, is used instead so that computes can be configured
without the distribution of additional keys.

Change-Id: I70da06159c0d3c6fa204b5f7a468909ffab4d633
Closes-Bug: #1439949
(cherry picked from commit a8ba5a41cdbcbc5b4123cc97e0e46f4c7702b8fa)

commit_message:
Fix behaviour of 'set-secret-value virsh' exec

Aims at fixing two issues: we had an unless clause which was only
checking if the secret was already defined, not if the value for
the secret was set; when providing the value for the secret, we
were mistakenly referring to the secret by its XML dump instead of
its UUID.

Change-Id: I513599735e974c07a6a0e46fd319930740f259cc
Closes-Bug: #1425601
(cherry picked from commit c44f7f023fb80cac0bda52a038cb2f8d33ac4e8e)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-04 02:15:09.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/compute/rbd.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_compute_rbd_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Allow libvirt secret key setting from param

Currently the libvirt secret key is demanded to the ceph cluster
via the $(ceph auth get-key ...) command which requires the ceph
cluste to be already up and also assumes the computes are provisioned
with the client.admin keyring.

With this change we add a libvirt_rbd_secret_key parameter which,
if passed, is used instead so that computes can be configured
without the distribution of additional keys.

Change-Id: I70da06159c0d3c6fa204b5f7a468909ffab4d633

commit_message:
Allow libvirt secret key setting from param

Currently the libvirt secret key is demanded to the ceph cluster
via the $(ceph auth get-key ...) command which requires the ceph
cluste to be already up and also assumes the computes are provisioned
with the client.admin keyring.

With this change we add a libvirt_rbd_secret_key parameter which,
if passed, is used instead so that computes can be configured
without the distribution of additional keys.

Change-Id: I70da06159c0d3c6fa204b5f7a468909ffab4d633
Closes-Bug: #1439949
(cherry picked from commit a8ba5a41cdbcbc5b4123cc97e0e46f4c7702b8fa)

commit_message:
Fix behaviour of 'set-secret-value virsh' exec

Aims at fixing two issues: we had an unless clause which was only
checking if the secret was already defined, not if the value for
the secret was set; when providing the value for the secret, we
were mistakenly referring to the secret by its XML dump instead of
its UUID.

Change-Id: I513599735e974c07a6a0e46fd319930740f259cc
Closes-Bug: #1425601
(cherry picked from commit c44f7f023fb80cac0bda52a038cb2f8d33ac4e8e)

commit_message:
Enable arp_accept for interfaces

This commit enables arp_accept for all interfaces
in order for nodes to be able to accept gratuitous
ARP requests when failover happens.

Change-Id: I499c7fa671d522854b803ed86907f06412e6e1ef
Closes-bug: #1456272

commit_message:
Get management partition (vm.get_mgmt_partition)

Implement a helper method to return the LPAR wrapper representing the
host's management partition.

This is needed for such operations as snapshot, which will need to map
a (normal) instance's storage to the management partition.

Change-Id: I0fb3f8e9191289b4778d4d7171547475dc6bcca5

subject: Always decode command-line arguments as UTF-8
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-18 22:59:10.000000000', 'files': ['swiftclient/shell.py', 'tests/unit/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'Always decode command-line arguments as UTF-8

There was always an implicit assumption that they were UTF-8 before, and
by converting them to unicode we close another hole allowing raw bytes
to appear in user-facing messages.

Change-Id: I88c06c5db835c8b56f269ab20fa279351bf4c70f
'}]
commit_message:
Always decode command-line arguments as UTF-8

There was always an implicit assumption that they were UTF-8 before, and
by converting them to unicode we close another hole allowing raw bytes
to appear in user-facing messages.

Change-Id: I88c06c5db835c8b56f269ab20fa279351bf4c70f

commit_message:
Return cell info dictionary instead of cell object.

cell_get() method returns Cell Object that cannot be dumped to
JSON. Also other get methods return cell info dictionary instead
of an object. To keep flow consistent and to get rid of ValueError
exception, changed cell_get() method to return cell info dictionary.

Change-Id: I236246f347460686bdead94e54db25c32698225b
Closes-Bug: #1312002

subject: Python 3: generalize the usage of the six module
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-15 20:42:17.000000000', 'files': ['tools/send_test_data.py', 'ceilometer/alarm/evaluator/combination.py', 'ceilometer/hardware/inspector/snmp.py', 'ceilometer/tests/alarm/evaluator/test_threshold.py', 'ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_statistics_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/storage/mongo/utils.py', 'ceilometer/compute/virt/vmware/inspector.py', 'ceilometer/tests/storage/test_impl_sqlalchemy.py', 'ceilometer/agent/base.py', 'ceilometer/alarm/evaluator/threshold.py', 'ceilometer/tests/objectstore/test_swift_middleware.py'], 'message': 'Python 3: generalize the usage of the six module

* Replace itertools.ifilter() with six.moves.filter()
* Replace itertools.imap() with six.moves.map()
* Replace map(_compare, statistics)
  with [_compare(statistic) for statistic in statistics]
* Replace obj.iterkeys() with six.iterkeys(obj)
* Replace obj.iteritems() with six.iteritems(obj)
* Replace xrange() with six.moves.xrange(), or with range() for small
  ranges
* Replace the repr module with six.moves.reprlib

Change-Id: Iaaa328cc15355182bde444a1aeaa4385691c8f90
'}]
commit_message:
Python 3: generalize the usage of the six module

* Replace itertools.ifilter() with six.moves.filter()
* Replace itertools.imap() with six.moves.map()
* Replace map(_compare, statistics)
  with [_compare(statistic) for statistic in statistics]
* Replace obj.iterkeys() with six.iterkeys(obj)
* Replace obj.iteritems() with six.iteritems(obj)
* Replace xrange() with six.moves.xrange(), or with range() for small
  ranges
* Replace the repr module with six.moves.reprlib

Change-Id: Iaaa328cc15355182bde444a1aeaa4385691c8f90

commit_message:
Use the recommended default for horizon default dashboards

Let horizon discover the default
dashboards via the INSTALL_APPS (which is already an attribute).
The patch removes the old hardcoded defaults which are no longer
needed nor recommmended.

Change-Id: I3c73756a6d834a9bae69ae6ead235e01cc747593
Closes-Bug: #1455063

commit_message:
Python 3: set __bool__() method on Namespace

The Python 2 __nonzero__() method was renamed to __bool__() in Python 3.

Create a __bool__ alias to __nonzero__ in the Namespace class.

Change-Id: I2ad3b3522b9ee2d33a5eee8886ee5f07776fb449

subject: support for keystone v3 api - allow v2 or v3 providers
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-05-13 17:51:15.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/keystone.rb'], 'message': 'support for keystone v3 api - allow v2 or v3 providers

This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:
1) Allows the providers to use the v2 or v3 identity api.

The keystone.rb provider provides these methods:
a) self.get_api_version_for_url - this is the version suffix to use
for the authentication endpoint.  By default it is "v2.0".  Providers
that support the v3 api should override this method to return "v3".

b) self.get_api_version_for_cmd - this is the api version provided
to the openstack command as --os-identity-api-version.  By default
this function returns [] the empty array which tells openstack to
use the version 2 default.  Providers that support the v3 api should
override this method to return ["--os-identity-api-version", "3"].

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

Change-Id: I6faf88e1f59a50d451356b2f4cab275178c47047
'}]
commit_message:
support for keystone v3 api - allow v2 or v3 providers

This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:
1) Allows the providers to use the v2 or v3 identity api.

The keystone.rb provider provides these methods:
a) self.get_api_version_for_url - this is the version suffix to use
for the authentication endpoint.  By default it is "v2.0".  Providers
that support the v3 api should override this method to return "v3".

b) self.get_api_version_for_cmd - this is the api version provided
to the openstack command as --os-identity-api-version.  By default
this function returns [] the empty array which tells openstack to
use the version 2 default.  Providers that support the v3 api should
override this method to return ["--os-identity-api-version", "3"].

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

Change-Id: I6faf88e1f59a50d451356b2f4cab275178c47047

subject: Remove redundancy in ArchivePoliciesController tests
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-11 12:41:21.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/tests/gabbi/gabbits/archive.yaml', 'gnocchi/tests/test_rest.py'], 'message': 'Remove redundancy in ArchivePoliciesController tests

Except for aggregation related tests, duplicate /v1/archive_policy
related tests from test_rest into gabbi tests to remove redundancy.

The initial plan was to just remove tests from test_rest that had
duplicates under gabbi, but it was easier to reconcile into one
source of authority.

Note the addition of two xfail-ing tests in archive.yaml. These fail
on python3 but not python2. The issue is in pecan as described in
the linked bug report.

Change-Id: I4a9d9f1f2a1ced072f91263bf8e819cc798b123a
'}]
commit_message:
Remove redundancy in ArchivePoliciesController tests

Except for aggregation related tests, duplicate /v1/archive_policy
related tests from test_rest into gabbi tests to remove redundancy.

The initial plan was to just remove tests from test_rest that had
duplicates under gabbi, but it was easier to reconcile into one
source of authority.

Note the addition of two xfail-ing tests in archive.yaml. These fail
on python3 but not python2. The issue is in pecan as described in
the linked bug report.

Change-Id: I4a9d9f1f2a1ced072f91263bf8e819cc798b123a

subject: Fix get_monitor function and local vars for rabbit OCF
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7468, 'name': 'Sergey Vasilenko', 'email': 'svasilenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'xenolog'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9387, 'name': 'Aleksandr Didenko', 'email': 'adidenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'AD'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 13344, 'name': 'Oleksiy Molchanov', 'email': 'omolchanov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'cvieri.lviv'}, {'_account_id': 14774, 'name': 'Fuel TPI CI', 'email': 'pi-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-tpi-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-18 15:56:23.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'Fix get_monitor function and local vars for rabbit OCF

W/o this fix:
* get_monitor() does not handle the case then rabbit
app is running and reports $OCF_RUNNING. This makes
the resource to stuck in semi-started state for ever.
* get_monitor() does not always record in logs when
sets master score 0 to ensure the slave does not get
promoted. This makes logging patterns not consistent.
* get_monitor() has two exit point for generic error case
instead of one. This makes logging patterns not consistent.
* some variables are missing the local
declaration and might be reused in another places
leading to unpredictable results. For example,
there is the nodelist var should be local as it is
used both action_notify(), get_monitor().

The solution is:
* fix missing local declarations for variables and
remove unused ones as well.
* add missing log record for "ensuring this slave does
not get promoted."
* handle the get_monitor() case when rabbit app is not
running as appropriate and report $OCF_NOT_RUNNING.
* make the single get_monitor() return point for the
$OCF_ERR_GENERIC case.

Closes-bug: #1455761

Change-Id: Iba5e9d984083acea1392cad0abd6453f5d6fbf8b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix get_monitor function and local vars for rabbit OCF

W/o this fix:
* get_monitor() does not handle the case then rabbit
app is running and reports $OCF_RUNNING. This makes
the resource to stuck in semi-started state for ever.
* get_monitor() does not always record in logs when
sets master score 0 to ensure the slave does not get
promoted. This makes logging patterns not consistent.
* get_monitor() has two exit point for generic error case
instead of one. This makes logging patterns not consistent.
* some variables are missing the local
declaration and might be reused in another places
leading to unpredictable results. For example,
there is the nodelist var should be local as it is
used both action_notify(), get_monitor().

The solution is:
* fix missing local declarations for variables and
remove unused ones as well.
* add missing log record for "ensuring this slave does
not get promoted."
* handle the get_monitor() case when rabbit app is not
running as appropriate and report $OCF_NOT_RUNNING.
* make the single get_monitor() return point for the
$OCF_ERR_GENERIC case.

Closes-bug: #1455761

Change-Id: Iba5e9d984083acea1392cad0abd6453f5d6fbf8b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Abort failed cherry-pick and reverts

If a temprevert or cherry-pick fails then we abort the
operation. We were doing something similar in the
temprevert function but this is cleaner and now both
functions are consistent.

Change-Id: I8c72cc7a2e1bc6d47f42e6a27b1c372058342253

commit_message:
Puppet: don't manage /etc/hosts via cloud-init

We don't want cloud-init manage /etc/hosts for the puppet jobs (it
prevents Corosync from setting up a cluster using hostnames), but we
need to keep it in the non-puppet jobs to have them pass.

Change-Id: Idb9ad017ffb1048f38fedbd55cc974785f6b1c38
Partial-Bug: #1447497
Depends-On: Ia8582883f737548e2911d3f36a1943e5b236281b
Depends-On: Iec5b6450c5730c081c8f2ca4d6c9786b956c87d5

subject: Set pipefail when running tsfilter
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-28 22:19:18.000000000', 'files': ['functions.sh'], 'message': 'Set pipefail when running tsfilter

The timestamp filter function pipes commands through awk to add
timestamps to those commands. We are interested in preserving the return
codes of those commands which requires pipefail. Set pipefail before
piping through awk then reset the old pipefail value after running
through awk.

Change-Id: I4e0ae2530669ec065a6cb78446cd27449beaeba9
'}]
commit_message:
Set pipefail when running tsfilter

The timestamp filter function pipes commands through awk to add
timestamps to those commands. We are interested in preserving the return
codes of those commands which requires pipefail. Set pipefail before
piping through awk then reset the old pipefail value after running
through awk.

commit_message:
Add UEFI support to ISO

* In UEFI bootloader is grub, not syslinux
* Removed mkisofs
* Removed isohybrid
* Add xorriso

Change-Id: I9158e939f388ef2000f898de4aed7f251202f6bd
Closes-Bug: #1433521

Add OpenStack logo in the footer

- add small transparent OpenStack logo in the slide footer
- logo and footer design is from OpenStack's
  OpenStackPowered-April2015.ppt master slides
- white background changed to transparent
- logo is pushed back with z-index: -2 (so it is behind background pic
  in the title slide)

commit_message:
Provide a longer timeout for HA scenario

HA Scenarios (3 controllers + 1 Node) may require more than 35 minutes
to run, hence increase the scenario timeout.

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-08 15:10:53.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_dellscapi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell/dell_storagecenter_common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell/dell_storagecenter_api.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_dellsc.py'], 'message': 'Dell: Added support for update_migrated_volume

Added support for updated_migrated_volume to common driver.
Added rename_volume to dell_storagecenter_api to support it.
Added tests to test_dellsc.py and test_dellapi.py.

The only thing we do in this rename the newly migrated volume
destination volume on the Dell Storage center to be the same
as the original volume ID.  Since we identify the volumes
by volume ID this prevents them from being lost.

Change-Id: I531e24853cf5db8b7c34d91460d3abe786a652de
Closes-bug: 1452919
'}]
commit_message:
Dell: Added support for update_migrated_volume

Added support for updated_migrated_volume to common driver.
Added rename_volume to dell_storagecenter_api to support it.
Added tests to test_dellsc.py and test_dellapi.py.

The only thing we do in this rename the newly migrated volume
destination volume on the Dell Storage center to be the same
as the original volume ID.  Since we identify the volumes
by volume ID this prevents them from being lost.

Change-Id: I531e24853cf5db8b7c34d91460d3abe786a652de
Closes-bug: 1452919

an HTML anchor element. This commit changes that. The links are

Change-Id: Ia05610afb32c7a86536b7f462d3cfc44f9a2ca7d

commit_message:
Hypervisor Support Matrix renders links in notes

The sphinx-extension which renders the support_matrix.ini file into
HTML did not recognize URLs in the notes which have to be written as
an HTML anchor element. This commit changes that. The links are
clickable now.

Closes-Bug: 1451468

Change-Id: Ia05610afb32c7a86536b7f462d3cfc44f9a2ca7d

commit_message:
Add new winimage-builder

* shell script based instead of make
* updated links on required software
* updated PowerShell unattended scripts
* updated autounattend & unattend xml templates files
* checked with Windows Server 2012 R2
* Windows 2008 R2 support - is not refactored(planned)

Change-Id: Id54c363e2c2f3d47f9b48c23a0368beec2fb6102

subject: Covered a bug in functional test infrastructure.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-13 17:55:28.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/functional/test_api.py'], 'message': 'Covered a bug in functional test infrastructure.

When api is launched with default flavor (no authentication) and
registry with fakeauth flavor (or any other requiring user token) any
CRUD operation via api without a valid token should return 401, as
long as the user receives 401 from glance registry.

But the expected behaviour is not observed with glance v2 api. The user
can still perform any operation without supplying a token in headers.

Change-Id: Iee9e9fc4a21ccc90489873b086beff68c730d38f
'}]
commit_message:
Covered a bug in functional test infrastructure.

When api is launched with default flavor (no authentication) and
registry with fakeauth flavor (or any other requiring user token) any
CRUD operation via api without a valid token should return 401, as
long as the user receives 401 from glance registry.

But the expected behaviour is not observed with glance v2 api. The user
can still perform any operation without supplying a token in headers.

Change-Id: Iee9e9fc4a21ccc90489873b086beff68c730d38f

This fix does not solve the root cause of the problem,
deadlock with fake thread is still there, but proper
solution with correct lock ordering is huge, so we
won't be able to land it in 6.1, this patch fixes

As result it will be possible to make backports to

commit_message:
Fix test test_cluster_locking_after_deployment

This fix does not solve the root cause of the problem,
deadlock with fake thread is still there, but proper
solution with correct lock ordering is huge, so we
won't be able to land it in 6.1, this patch fixes
the problem and lives logic of the tests as is.
As result it will be possible to make backports to
this branch without random test fails.

Change-Id: I7cf4c4ce0507afeda760fc1fbdeabac43b0e2909
Closes-bug: #1455467

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-14 18:04:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_fields.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/objects/hv_spec.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_compute_node.py', 'nova/objects/fields.py'], 'message': 'objects: convert HVSpec to use named enums

The hv_type, vm_mode and arch fields in the HVSpec object all
accept a finite list of values, so should be represented by
an Enum field instead of String. This converts HVSpec to use
the existing ArchitectureField, and also defines VMModeField
and HVTypeField classes.

The hash of VirtCPUModel changes because the field classname
has changed from String to an enum type. The HVSpec objects
are populated based on data reported by the hypervisor
drivers. These are using the named constants and validation
code to ensure only well known values are recorded in the
data. So this change to an enum type should be ABI-compatible
and thus the version is not incremented.

Change-Id: Iffbc9bd3532e7bfbfe2aefee52621ceb3fb57f27
'}]
commit_message:
objects: convert HVSpec to use named enums

The hv_type, vm_mode and arch fields in the HVSpec object all
accept a finite list of values, so should be represented by
an Enum field instead of String. This converts HVSpec to use
the existing ArchitectureField, and also defines VMModeField
and HVTypeField classes.

The hash of VirtCPUModel changes because the field classname
has changed from String to an enum type. The HVSpec objects
are populated based on data reported by the hypervisor
drivers. These are using the named constants and validation
code to ensure only well known values are recorded in the
data. So this change to an enum type should be ABI-compatible
and thus the version is not incremented.

Change-Id: Iffbc9bd3532e7bfbfe2aefee52621ceb3fb57f27

commit_message:
Fix two bugs in cluster resize

1. The parameter parsing of adjustment number should allow
   negative input value for scaling in scenario;
2. The desired value should be the sum of current and rounded
   when adjustment type is CHANGE_IN_PERCENTAGE.

Change-Id: Ib19d7a61c220ea61786acd078e5d3e329e3006dd

subject: Remove pacemaker haproxy resource (temporary)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-17 17:49:07.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': 'Remove pacemaker haproxy resource (temporary)

Currently an issue with HAProxy pacemaker resource prevent the HA
deployment from working.

HAProxy can be started on all nodes (pcs resource create --clone), even
though the haproxy configuration is not written on the non
$pacemaker_master node. Since the VIP can be on any node, if the vip end
up in a non $pacemaker_master node then deployment will fail.

NOTE: This is temporary, it aims to validate that the review[1] including
the changes to the new version of puppet-pacemaker works.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/183103/

Change-Id: I378bbdf73404f7286be30f485f42188b2922a80b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove pacemaker haproxy resource (temporary)

Currently an issue with HAProxy pacemaker resource prevent the HA
deployment from working.

HAProxy can be started on all nodes (pcs resource create --clone), even
though the haproxy configuration is not written on the non
$pacemaker_master node. Since the VIP can be on any node, if the vip end
up in a non $pacemaker_master node then deployment will fail.

NOTE: This is temporary, it aims to validate that the review[1] including
the changes to the new version of puppet-pacemaker works.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/183103/

Change-Id: I378bbdf73404f7286be30f485f42188b2922a80b

commit_message:
Add url access verification that will setup network

Added command that will perform setup and teardown of
required networking configuration.

Network configuration will perform next things:

- set interface up if required
- create vlan tagged interface and set it up
- add required ipv4 settings for interface
- add default route

After verification teardown will be performed.
Teardown is best effort based - e.g we should not fail whole command
if we cant fully execute teardown.

Change-Id: I910c15c2b39a917eb8428bb69271b5dde364b639
Partial-Bug: 1439686

commit_message:
objects: convert VirtCPUModel to use named enums

The VirtCPUModel class currently uses anonymous enums for a
number of fields. Since some of the same enums will be required
in other objects, convert them to named enums instead.

The import of nova.compute.arch and nova.compute.cpumodel is
a temporary state. The intention is that the constants in those
two modules actually get moved into the enum classes themselves
allowing the modules to be removed. This is to be done in a
later commit.

The hash of VirtCPUModel changes because the field classname
has changed. The version is not incremented though, because
this is an ABI-compatible change.

Change-Id: Id79793510e02d47f9ef377b7b3a9ffa08dff4a66

commit_message:
Fixing "report_tempest_results.py"

The script "report_tempest_results.py" doesn't work and constantly fails
with the following error:

    TypeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute '__getitem__'

This patch is entended to fix this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1456139

Change-Id: Iff3fdf198bcca71321522c5938b128995d0d6cea

commit_message:
Do not fail test on post snapshot creation step

If test passed, but creation of diagnostic snapshot
failed after test, then error is printed to console,
but test isn't marked as failed.

Change-Id: I5e3df9045900254538fe6ccd3b7334e75f5410ac
Closes-bug: #1455781

commit_message:
Move VersionedObject registration to the new scheme

In oslo.versionedobjects, objects are registered inside a separate
ObjectRegistry class. Each object is registered with a decorator
(with less magic). Also remove unused check_object_version method.

Related to blueprint versioned-objects

Change-Id: I0f9fd3fdaa754480ccd9e18b6c15501900aa46ee

wrap 'ip addr add ...' by begin-rescue

This prevent situation, when between l23_stored_config and l3_ifconfig
ifup event happens.

Change-Id: I90e671b71c667c74d08b53915a43e2baccb78732

commit_message:
Change default network mode for env creation to neutron

Now when user choses nova-network as network mode for environment
warning about deprecation is displayed. segmentation-type  parameter is
now also supplied by default and is equal to "vlan". Tests updated.

Change-Id: Idb1d5caac4f3e2c4d9661eb8162eaabefa4fca49
Closes-Bug: #1455739

Added ability to use placeholders in datasource URLs. Currently
supported placeholders:
* %RANDSTR(len)% - will be replaced with random string of
  lowercase letters of length `len`.
* %JOB_EXEC_ID% - will be replaced with the job execution ID.

commit_message:
Implemented support of placeholders in datasource URLs

Added ability to use placeholders in datasource URLs. Currently
supported placeholders:
* %RANDSTR(len)% - will be replaced with random string of
  lowercase letters of length `len`.
* %JOB_EXEC_ID% - will be replaced with the job execution ID.

Resulting URLs will be stored in a new field at job_execution
table. Using 'info' field doesn't look as good solution since it
is reserved for oozie status.

Next steps:
* write documentation
* update horizon

Implements blueprint: edp-datasource-placeholders

Change-Id: I1d9282b210047982c062b24bd03cf2331ab7599e

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-15 15:13:44.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'sahara/tests/unit/conductor/manager/test_templates.py', 'sahara/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix cluster templates update

This change fixes the following issues:

* Remove _appy_defaults for cluster template fields on update
  Fields that are not specified should not be given default values
  on update like they are on creation.  If a field is not specified,
  it should be left alone

* Do not delete node groups if the cluster template update does
  specify a node_group field

Closes-Bug: #1438077
Change-Id: I65dd15e02871f9c7227d2b51acedd6e06cb04950
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cluster templates update

This change fixes the following issues:

* Remove _appy_defaults for cluster template fields on update
  Fields that are not specified should not be given default values
  on update like they are on creation.  If a field is not specified,
  it should be left alone

* Do not delete node groups if the cluster template update does
  specify a node_group field

Closes-Bug: #1438077
Change-Id: I65dd15e02871f9c7227d2b51acedd6e06cb04950

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-17 16:15:54.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/cobbler_manager_spec.rb', 'lib/astute/cobbler_manager.rb', 'lib/astute/provision.rb', 'spec/unit/provision_spec.rb'], 'message': "Prevented failed nodes from being rebooted

Provision fault tolerance makes it possible
to continue deployment even if some of nodes
failed while being provisioned. But if
reboot such failed node with chain loader
it likely can stick on this stage and we won't
be able to reboot it any way except turning it off
and on.

This change prevents failed nodes from being rebooted
with chain loader. Besides this patch sets
profile for IBP nodes into 'bootstrap', so as to

Closes-Bug: #1455385

commit_message:
Prevented failed nodes from being rebooted

Provision fault tolerance makes it possible
to continue deployment even if some of nodes
failed while being provisioned. But if
reboot such failed node with chain loader
it likely can stick on this stage and we won't
be able to reboot it any way except turning it off
and on.

This change prevents failed nodes from being rebooted
with chain loader. Besides this patch sets
profile for IBP nodes into 'bootstrap', so as to
avoid them being booted with anaconda or debian-installer.

Change-Id: Id2b500d359fa2772ef0a81bef37f2f7152894b00
Closes-Bug: #1455385

commit_message:
Install Oozie UI on MapR clusters

It's needed to rebuild Oozie war with ExtJS archive
specified to make Oozie UI work. Note that we have
to rebuild it every time configure.sh runs on Oozie
node because script rebuilds it w/o ExtJS.

Closes-Bug: #1439452
Change-Id: I14e2c6742913898f3a129d4423c8cbf2be8f7632
(cherry picked from commit 06905eac10fc81f8b887a53ca0893382481dad32)

commit_message:
Change augtool invocation

- Change autosave mode to configuration file mode, because
  in Precise augtool return wrong value with augtool -s command.
- Add -e flag, and now it not trigger any dib-lint error

Change-Id: I239d403d1c20782525766c67b139e40c00907792
Closes-Bug: #1450510
Partial-Bug: #1435306

commit_message:
Force tagging on docker restore

Docker refuses to allow latest tags to be written
if there is already a newer latest tag without
-f option.

Change-Id: I72e9e3addff6f2be5b66dc18d3162c19045c4e47
Closes-Bug: #1448211

commit_message:
Added xz package to shotgun spec

That is for making it possible to use xz for
compressing diagnostic snapshot instead of gzip.
It gonna take twice as less place as gzip one.

Related fuel-web patch: Ia8ba5d584ea97de4f476cb8bb632ca82baa76503

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1394487

Change-Id: Ia35fb7294c85d0463860ca8af9812834522f5605

Without - it fails on bootstrap with traceback:

commit_message:
Add EDITOR variable in urlaccesschecker

This variable required by cmd2 library to work.
Without - it fails on bootstrap with traceback:

File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/cmd2.py", line 424, in Cmd
if subprocess.Popen(['which', editor])

Change-Id: I061f88b65d7bc7181752cd076da4067df2f84131
Related-Bug: 1439686

commit_message:
Check if nodes are able to connect to ubuntu repos

 * Add CheckNodesToRepositoryConnectionTask
 * Add above task call to ApplyChangesTaskManager
 * Add repo_connection_resp to to receiver
 * Add process synchronization by barrier
 * Make ApplyChangesTaskManager wait for new subtask using barrier
 * Add new fake task type for execute_shell astute action

Change-Id: I3c13afc0a1cef42efd42f26d7593ada8c3ce44c4
Depends-On: Ie507f695644237f1a1a8f3b6d212d236a3ab317d
Closes-Bug: #1439686

Before provisioning there is an additional check - all nodes that have
provile that contains 'ubuntu' (assumption is that they are indeed
Ubuntu nodes) are trying to get 'Release' file from all their
repositiories to make sure that installation will fail due to lack of
access to needed packages.

Wget is used to check ability to retrieve files from repositories. It is
invoked on nodes via MCollective agent action 'execute_shell_command'.

commit_message:
Check if Ubuntu nodes can access repositories

Before provisioning there is an additional check - all nodes that have
provile that contains 'ubuntu' (assumption is that they are indeed
Ubuntu nodes) are trying to get 'Release' file from all their
repositiories to make sure that installation will fail due to lack of
access to needed packages.

Wget is used to check ability to retrieve files from repositories. It is
invoked on nodes via MCollective agent action 'execute_shell_command'.

Also added pry to developer dependencies.

Change-Id: Ie507f695644237f1a1a8f3b6d212d236a3ab317d
Closes-Bug: #1439686

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-17 10:23:46.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_plugin_builder/fuel_plugin_builder/messages.py'], 'message': 'Adding dpkg-dev to required CentOS packages

After dpkg-devel upgraded to dpkg-devel-1.16.16-5.el6.x86_64 there was
no longer dpkg-scanpackages command available on the machine until
installing dpkg-dev-1.16.16-5.el6.noarch.

Before installing dpkg-dev, the plugin build crashed because

Closes-bug: #1455882

Change-Id: I588ce4291b03c7cec27c3dfbac350575aa1699b4
'}]
commit_message:
Adding dpkg-dev to required CentOS packages

After dpkg-devel upgraded to dpkg-devel-1.16.16-5.el6.x86_64 there was
no longer dpkg-scanpackages command available on the machine until
installing dpkg-dev-1.16.16-5.el6.noarch.

Before installing dpkg-dev, the plugin build crashed because
dpkg-scanpackages is a required command in order to build a fuel plugin.

Closes-bug: #1455882

Change-Id: I588ce4291b03c7cec27c3dfbac350575aa1699b4

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-05 03:24:38.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/utils.py'], 'message': 'Respect configured cred provider in scenario utils

This commit fixes the scenario util classes to actually used the
configured credential provider. Previously these classes were making
a bare call to Manager() to setup the clients. However without passing
it credentials to use Manager tries to use credentials from the config
file regardless of whether tempest is configured using the old config
options for credentials. (it ignores the accounts.yaml or tenant
isolation settings)

Closes-Bug: #1451484
Change-Id: Ie3bca345e094c00299167d37150cca3d6c1d8b38
'}]
commit_message:
Respect configured cred provider in scenario utils

This commit fixes the scenario util classes to actually used the
configured credential provider. Previously these classes were making
a bare call to Manager() to setup the clients. However without passing
it credentials to use Manager tries to use credentials from the config
file regardless of whether tempest is configured using the old config
options for credentials. (it ignores the accounts.yaml or tenant
isolation settings)

Closes-Bug: #1451484
Change-Id: Ie3bca345e094c00299167d37150cca3d6c1d8b38

commit_message:
Fix appearing an error message when build Storm with other than Ubuntu

Storm doesn’t support other than Ubuntu.
If base_image_os is selected Fedora or CentOS,
appear an error message instead of building Storm with Ubuntu.

Change-Id: Icfa07ab764b69e19423065061d88ee4079fb66a4
Closes-Bug: #1441589

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-15 14:20:29.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_seed.sh'], 'message': "Add support for overriding cache just for seed

When testing with the seed as the undercloud, I'm frequently wanting
to rebuild just the seed VM image, e.g when I know the overcloud images
are good, but I want to test a new heat patch.

This adds support for SEED_USE_CACHE, which will override the global

Change-Id: I81f256feedbee26a258333a68bf8715bbc7710bf

commit_message:
Add support for overriding cache just for seed

When testing with the seed as the undercloud, I'm frequently wanting
to rebuild just the seed VM image, e.g when I know the overcloud images
are good, but I want to test a new heat patch.

This adds support for SEED_USE_CACHE, which will override the global
USE_CACHE variable if set.

Change-Id: I81f256feedbee26a258333a68bf8715bbc7710bf

subject: Use Keystone V3 API openstack role list --group
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-15 14:59:55.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': 'Use Keystone V3 API openstack role list --group

Devstack functions-common::get_or_add_group_project_role uses
--group options, which only exists in Keystone V3 API. Howere here
the python-openstackclietn defaults to use V2 API, triggers
"unrecognized arguments: --group" error.

This patch fixes the bug by forcing openstack client to use V3 API.
The existing functions-common::get_or_create_group are already
using the same way. See

https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/functions-common#L678

Change-Id: I6a60c88a90958f2a95da383d45a80db9b5c02d7e
Closes-bug: #1441010
'}]
commit_message:
Use Keystone V3 API openstack role list --group

Devstack functions-common::get_or_add_group_project_role uses
--group options, which only exists in Keystone V3 API. Howere here
the python-openstackclietn defaults to use V2 API, triggers
"unrecognized arguments: --group" error.

This patch fixes the bug by forcing openstack client to use V3 API.
The existing functions-common::get_or_create_group are already
using the same way. See

https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/functions-common#L678

Change-Id: I6a60c88a90958f2a95da383d45a80db9b5c02d7e
Closes-bug: #1441010

subject: Optimized get_tenant_by_id()
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-18 07:01:23.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/l3_openflow_app.py'], 'message': "Optimized get_tenant_by_id()

Instead of creating an empty TenantTopology object every time you try
and get a tenant it will only do it where one doesn't already exist. By
still using dict.setdefault() we keep it thread safe for the corner
cases.

Change-Id: Ie754482ef1b9585251ebd887c434dcb1ea038853
"}]
commit_message:
Optimized get_tenant_by_id()

Instead of creating an empty TenantTopology object every time you try
and get a tenant it will only do it where one doesn't already exist. By
still using dict.setdefault() we keep it thread safe for the corner
cases.

Change-Id: Ie754482ef1b9585251ebd887c434dcb1ea038853

commit_message:
Fix kill for rabbit OCF

* There is undefined stop_pid argument could be
passed to the kill command for some cases when rabbit
app cannot be stopped gracefully. Renamed to pid.
* There is also unnecessary "kill" code duplication exist
and is removed.
* The pid value passed for the kill command is now always
verified to be not empty.

Closes-bug: #1455880

Change-Id: I0af8e275873c08fd44d3fc3abf40b7e99674986d
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Handle optional dependency in vmware store

oslo_vmware is an optional dependency for glance_store. Hence, we
should be able to register the store options even if the library
is not installed. There are two problems addressed here :-
1. The import error was not handled.
2. One of the store opt referenced a constant from the library.

Change-Id: I234a935f33e1cf8c3d6123994447bfca2365c3bb

commit_message:
Remove size related parameters from cluster updating

Now we don't allow to update size related properties of cluster, e.g.
min_size, max_size, desired_capacity. These properties can only be
changed using cluster resizing

Change-Id: I0f1c1c866d41ae5b9e99005b7946ccc635749c77

+ Noting that she will eventually migrate to Neutron (and why she chose
nova-network now)
+ Broke second sentence into three for readability
+ Clarified use of 'with' VLAN Manager
+ Updated OpenStack Networking (neutron) per convention
+ Added a missing word in second sentence
+ Updated VLAN network manager per convention

commit_message:
Updating Alice's case studies for intro, communication, and docs

Updating the Alice case studies for introduction, secure communication,
and system documentation sections. This outlines a more specific and
more comprehensive case study as well as ensuring consistency for
the examples and compliance standard used. Adding RC4 algorithm to
the not recommended list, and updating per doc conventions.

commit_message:
Add support of container resource management with "name"

This patch supports magnum container resource related
commands to run with name of the resource also.
Below is the list of commands:
 - container-delete
 - container-show
 - container-reboot
 - container-stop
 - container-start
 - container-pause
 - container-unpause
 - container-logs
 - container-execute

Change-Id: I4aaa1346a9411a8d0a9088c8fb216ee36df90915
Partially-Implements: blueprint name-based-resource-management

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2015-05-18 00:53:16.000000000', 'files': ['hacking/core.py', 'hacking/checks/vim_check.py', 'README.rst', 'hacking/tests/test_doctest.py', 'setup.cfg', 'tox.ini', 'HACKING.rst'], 'message': "Add support for flake8 off_by_default for optional checks

This allows hacking checks to be added as optional which means
that they are assumed to be excluded and have to be explicitly
added as part of a 'select' entry in the [flake8]
stanza of tox.ini.

The goal is to allow checks to be staged into the projects instead
of requiring all of the projects to change to adhere to the
check prior to the check being added (which creates a window where
failing code could be added).  Instead checks can be staged in with
enforcement and once all (or the majority) of projects have enabled
it, the check can be changed to a required check.

One optional check is added as an example:
  H106: Don't put vim configuration in source files

Depends-On: I7f8ef22254703a53b73ccd048322191cfc677958
Change-Id: If188f85e8093974802bd2bacc2a72b2ae35ee5a1
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for flake8 off_by_default for optional checks

This allows hacking checks to be added as optional which means
that they are assumed to be excluded and have to be explicitly
added as part of a 'select' entry in the [flake8]
stanza of tox.ini.

The goal is to allow checks to be staged into the projects instead
of requiring all of the projects to change to adhere to the
check prior to the check being added (which creates a window where
failing code could be added).  Instead checks can be staged in with
enforcement and once all (or the majority) of projects have enabled
it, the check can be changed to a required check.

One optional check is added as an example:
  H106: Don't put vim configuration in source files

Depends-On: I7f8ef22254703a53b73ccd048322191cfc677958
Change-Id: If188f85e8093974802bd2bacc2a72b2ae35ee5a1

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-13 08:44:40.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/deploy/install-guide.rst', 'ironic/common/pxe_utils.py', 'ironic/tests/test_pxe_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix chainloading iPXE (undionly.kpxe)

This patch is making the neutron DHCP provider to explicitly check if
the request is coming from iPXE before ACK'ing the PXE request with the
iPXE script (When iPXE is enabled only).

Also, update the documentation that explains how to configure neutron

Change-Id: I60f9f515a9bd45aed6b2f6f9165a2f85259b3879
Closes-Bug: #1454332
'}]
commit_message:
Fix chainloading iPXE (undionly.kpxe)

This patch is making the neutron DHCP provider to explicitly check if
the request is coming from iPXE before ACK'ing the PXE request with the
iPXE script (When iPXE is enabled only).

Also, update the documentation that explains how to configure neutron
for iPXE to create the "ipxe" tag based on the DHCP user class or DHCP
option 175 (as before).

Change-Id: I60f9f515a9bd45aed6b2f6f9165a2f85259b3879
Closes-Bug: #1454332

commit_message:
Reduce AMT Driver's dependence on new release of Openwsman

As Openwsman>=2.4.10 is not widely supported so far, like Ubuntu.
Reduce AMT Driver's dependence on the new release of Openwsman to become
more user friendly.

Specifically, this enables setting the boot device even with Openwsman v2.4.3

Change-Id: I52c67cd9aa3b1693375e95ee1a582a08623308a9
Close-Bug: #1454018

commit_message:
Add volume status to error messages in backup create flow

If volume status is not 'available' we can't create a backup. Adding
current volume status to error message will make logs more
user-friendly.

Change-Id: Iab7a794a5104b28c54de23571f589fcf60e09c7d

commit_message:
supports alembic migration for db2

This patch adds the optional runtime dependency to support db2
for alembic migration, will not break the default mysql path.

And I did the testing in db2 env, works fine.

Change-Id: I59deff0d82bc9e2e7ceaa157c626cd2bb7a36f0d
Closes-Bug: 1444270
(cherry picked from commit a4ade0beaa196db26595301b9692d6236af61709)

For instance, by default, you typically limit table size to 20 but only display
that there are more than 20 returned entities at the bottom of a page.

commit_message:
pagination info at top and bottom of table

Pagination info at top and bottom of any horizon table.
For instance, by default, you typically limit table size to 20 but only display
that there are more than 20 returned entities at the bottom of a page.
Good ux design principles require that you display this at top and
bottom of a page.
And that you be able to go to the next "n" entries from the top or
bottom via a navigator button.

Change-Id: I68b077042b0781845d27b26708c702b6c9dfba26
Closes-Bug: #1359238
Signed-off-by: Kuo-tung Kao <jelly.k@inwinstack.com>

subject: pagination info at top and bottom of table

Pagination info at top and bottom of any horizon table.
For instance, by default, you typically limit table size to 20 but only display

commit_message:
pagination info at top and bottom of table

Pagination info at top and bottom of any horizon table.
For instance, by default, you typically limit table size to 20 but only display
that there are more than 20 returned entities at the bottom of a page.
Good ux design principles require that you display this at top and
bottom of a page.
And that you be able to go to the next "n" entries from the top or
bottom via a navigator button.

Fix the test code.

Beofre:
The number of '<th' is  7 + 1
1 for button column
7 for the column of pagination info.

After:
The number of '<th' is  7 + 7 + 1
1 for button column
7 for the top column of pagination info.
7 for the bottom column of pagination info.

Change-Id: Ie3a459ef1198cd7e5cfa50d4340840d10846818f
Closes-Bug: #1359238
Signed-off-by: Kuo-tung Kao <jelly.k@inwinstack.com>

subject: Don't set tempest fixed_network_name with neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-15 18:24:56.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': "Don't set tempest fixed_network_name with neutron

If neutron is enabled then there isn't a shared private network
between all tenants which is what is required for the
fixed_network_name config option. This commit adds a conditional
to not set that option when neutron is enabled. While not necessarily
fatal to tempest it does emit a warning on almost every server create
call if it is set with a non-existent network name.

Change-Id: I1a42fa6b0b5a93b411c08ec35df043d6ea69d453
"}]
commit_message:
Don't set tempest fixed_network_name with neutron

If neutron is enabled then there isn't a shared private network
between all tenants which is what is required for the
fixed_network_name config option. This commit adds a conditional
to not set that option when neutron is enabled. While not necessarily
fatal to tempest it does emit a warning on almost every server create
call if it is set with a non-existent network name.

Change-Id: I1a42fa6b0b5a93b411c08ec35df043d6ea69d453

commit_message:
Disable propagating BadStoreConfiguration

Commit I1d4f95cba47d21f1eb7e580314d01ac8d3481586 propergates
BadStoreConfiguration to the consumer of glance_store. This breaks
backwards compatibility for existing glance installations, however. This
patch disables it for the time being.

Change-Id: I46e1e38bf0b3ba9f78b4e553178b49bee929e0fd

subject: Enable netfilter on bridges
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-06 05:05:40.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron-legacy'], 'message': "Enable netfilter on bridges

There is a long-standing issue with netfilter enablement on bridges
which differs across distributions.  For some history see [1]

Neutron requires this enabled as documented in [2].  This change
allows centos7+neutron to pass the security group tests in tempest.

I will investigate why neutron can't do this itself.  Ubuntu don't
notice because their defaults are on.  Other than the documentation
change in [2], it seems we also work around this in other deployment
methods (e.g. packstack with
Ia8c86dcb31810a8d6b133a161388604fde9bead4).

[1] http://wiki.libvirt.org/page/Net.bridge-nf-call_and_sysctl.conf
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/icehouse/install-guide/install/apt/content/neutron-ml2-network-node.html

Change-Id: I4ee1a34c2549eddbdd32d67059dad7af0cae48e0
"}]
commit_message:
Enable netfilter on bridges

There is a long-standing issue with netfilter enablement on bridges
which differs across distributions.  For some history see [1]

Neutron requires this enabled as documented in [2].  This change
allows centos7+neutron to pass the security group tests in tempest.

I will investigate why neutron can't do this itself.  Ubuntu don't
notice because their defaults are on.  Other than the documentation
change in [2], it seems we also work around this in other deployment
methods (e.g. packstack with
Ia8c86dcb31810a8d6b133a161388604fde9bead4).

[1] http://wiki.libvirt.org/page/Net.bridge-nf-call_and_sysctl.conf
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/icehouse/install-guide/install/apt/content/neutron-ml2-network-node.html

Change-Id: I4ee1a34c2549eddbdd32d67059dad7af0cae48e0

subject: rabbit: fixes a logging issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-06 09:17:21.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "rabbit: fixes a logging issue

When uses the default port, kombu.Connection.port is None

So we replace the usage of kombu.Connection.port per
kombu.Connection.info(), to get the default value.

Also some transport driver have 'None' for hostname or port as default
value, so replace usage of '%d' per '%s', to ensure the logging never fail.
Event the output of the log is less sexy.

Change-Id: I89ca1982246146717015253bd4cc26f992381584
Closes-bug: #1452189
"}]
commit_message:
rabbit: fixes a logging issue

When uses the default port, kombu.Connection.port is None

So we replace the usage of kombu.Connection.port per
kombu.Connection.info(), to get the default value.

Also some transport driver have 'None' for hostname or port as default
value, so replace usage of '%d' per '%s', to ensure the logging never fail.
Event the output of the log is less sexy.

Change-Id: I89ca1982246146717015253bd4cc26f992381584
Closes-bug: #1452189

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-05-15 18:00:07.000000000', 'files': ['spec/register_spec.rb', 'providers/register.rb'], 'message': 'Check whether to recreate service if it exists

    The create_service action only checks to see if a service
    with the same uuid exists, and if it does, it skips.  This
    addition checks to see whether a service matches the fields
    and deletes + recreates if fields need to be updated.

    Also included the specs for the ne functionality.

    It looks like the create_endpoint action already does this.
    Used the same process for checking the service.

Change-Id: I2013877f2f47096324386645f373690f5d9af4f5
Closes-Bug: #1306501
Closes-Bug: #1454022

commit_message:
Check whether to recreate service if it exists

    The create_service action only checks to see if a service
    with the same uuid exists, and if it does, it skips.  This
    addition checks to see whether a service matches the fields
    and deletes + recreates if fields need to be updated.

    Also included the specs for the ne functionality.

    It looks like the create_endpoint action already does this.
    Used the same process for checking the service.

Change-Id: I2013877f2f47096324386645f373690f5d9af4f5
Closes-Bug: #1306501
Closes-Bug: #1454022

subject: Find resource refactoring
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-12 11:53:05.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/tests/unit/v1/test_shell.py', 'cinderclient/v1/volume_snapshots.py', 'cinderclient/v1/volume_transfers.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'cinderclient/v1/volume_backups.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v1/fakes.py', 'cinderclient/v1/volumes.py', 'cinderclient/v2/volume_snapshots.py', 'cinderclient/v2/volume_backups.py', 'cinderclient/utils.py', 'cinderclient/v2/volume_transfers.py'], 'message': "Find resource refactoring

The 'name' field for some resources is called something different,
for example 'display_name' for volumes, 'name' for  volumes type.
So class 'resource' has attribute 'NAME_ATTR' wich contains
attribute name for different resources.

This change removes reduntant call find in resource manager, instead
of it checks NAME_ATTR value.

Related-Bug: #1449444
Change-Id: Ide334d7535c73cbdff72c30319eb539d8f5304d6
"}]
commit_message:
Find resource refactoring

The 'name' field for some resources is called something different,
for example 'display_name' for volumes, 'name' for  volumes type.
So class 'resource' has attribute 'NAME_ATTR' wich contains
attribute name for different resources.

This change removes reduntant call find in resource manager, instead
of it checks NAME_ATTR value.

Related-Bug: #1449444
Change-Id: Ide334d7535c73cbdff72c30319eb539d8f5304d6

subject: Catch client exceptions during list ops
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-15 12:59:02.000000000', 'files': ['shade/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Catch client exceptions during list ops

We were not consistently catching the underlying client exceptions
from the list operations, and just letting them escape as non-wrapped
exceptions. This corrects that.

Also, list_images() was trying to catch an OpenStackCloudException
that was never going to happen from the code in the try block.

Change-Id: Ia863ec2f988c7e90138097be15cd66fc858d1b21
'}]
commit_message:
Catch client exceptions during list ops

We were not consistently catching the underlying client exceptions
from the list operations, and just letting them escape as non-wrapped
exceptions. This corrects that.

Also, list_images() was trying to catch an OpenStackCloudException
that was never going to happen from the code in the try block.

Change-Id: Ia863ec2f988c7e90138097be15cd66fc858d1b21

commit_message:
[install-guide] Ubuntu release package updates

Update the following items for the Ubuntu release packages
(2015.1):

1) Use RabbitMQ packages from the cloud archive repository.

2) Change default role from '_member_' to 'user' to avoid
   potential interference with an internal role.

3) Remove explicit configuration of 'log_dir' option in
   keystone.

4) Remove step to disable default host in Apache.

5) Update CirrOS image to 0.3.4.

Some of these changes apply to all distributions.

Change-Id: If1cdf839ebdc7655b89ab14df694a9c25f0c35cf
Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-17 17:55:24.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/vmops.py'], 'message': 'Fix event handler NotFound error

When an instance is destroyed, it is stopped first. The manager
will get the event and consider it an unexpected power off, so
it will try to call the stop API as well.

Meanwhile, the instance might be deleted, in which case the above
operation will fail with an "NotFound" error.

This can be avoided by catching this in the power off method.

(cherry picked from commit e6f864841b02bb9637e95bc08c36c812052d0d55)

Change-Id: Ibd173bfb6cefa7cd585eee2ff48b583841b1c05c

commit_message:
Fix event handler NotFound error

When an instance is destroyed, it is stopped first. The manager
will get the event and consider it an unexpected power off, so
it will try to call the stop API as well.

Meanwhile, the instance might be deleted, in which case the above
operation will fail with an "NotFound" error.

This can be avoided by catching this in the power off method.

(cherry picked from commit e6f864841b02bb9637e95bc08c36c812052d0d55)

Change-Id: Ibd173bfb6cefa7cd585eee2ff48b583841b1c05c

subject: Fix serial console handler cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-17 17:54:34.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/namedpipe.py', 'hyperv/nova/serialconsoleops.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_namedpipe.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_serialconsoleops.py'], 'message': "Fix serial console handler cleanup

The named pipe handler stop method checks if the 'stopped' event
was set before attempting to perform cleanup. The issue is if one
worker fails, it will set this event, preventing the stop method
from performing the cleanup.

In this case, the VM console log files will remain open, unable to
be deleted when the VM is destroyed.

This check can be safely removed.

The serial console handler is now stopped in case some workers
fail to start, avoiding the above mentioned situation.

Change-Id: I6b431cc530b87defeb0b10e1886f030a452b4b06
(cherry picked from commit f01e14de9a251643ee172f98b90a3a83db1c24b4)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix serial console handler cleanup

The named pipe handler stop method checks if the 'stopped' event
was set before attempting to perform cleanup. The issue is if one
worker fails, it will set this event, preventing the stop method
from performing the cleanup.

In this case, the VM console log files will remain open, unable to
be deleted when the VM is destroyed.

This check can be safely removed.

The serial console handler is now stopped in case some workers
fail to start, avoiding the above mentioned situation.

Change-Id: I6b431cc530b87defeb0b10e1886f030a452b4b06
(cherry picked from commit f01e14de9a251643ee172f98b90a3a83db1c24b4)

commit_message:
Fix serial console handler cleanup

The named pipe handler stop method checks if the 'stopped' event
was set before attempting to perform cleanup. The issue is if one
worker fails, it will set this event, preventing the stop method
from performing the cleanup.

In this case, the VM console log files will remain open, unable to
be deleted when the VM is destroyed.

This check can be safely removed.

The serial console handler is now stopped in case some workers
fail to start, avoiding the above mentioned situation.

Change-Id: I6b431cc530b87defeb0b10e1886f030a452b4b06

commit_message:
Update IPv6 Prefix Delegation spec to include pluggable framework

Adds clarification that the PD client framework should be pluggable
to allow for different clients to be used in the future. Includes
some other small changes which better describe the Dibbler reference
implementation.

blueprint ipv6-prefix-delegation

Change-Id: Ice778a50ecff96ee663b83a477ff0f8bcf2ea745

revisions:
[{'number': 38, 'created': '2015-05-15 17:37:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/tests/contrib/gate_hook.sh', 'neutron_vpnaas/tests/contrib/post_test_hook.sh', 'tox.ini', 'tools/configure_for_vpn_func_testing.sh'], 'message': "VPNaaS: Revise functional test hooks

This commit does several things to allow functional tests to run, using a
DevStack configuration, but without stacking.

First, the gate_hook.sh is modified to specified environment variables
needed for processing, and will call configure_vpn_for_func_testing.sh.

The new configure_for_vpn_func_testing.sh script will first call the Neutron
configure_for_func_testing.sh script (as modified in [1]) to setup DevStack.
The script then installs the IPSec package, based on the functional job, and
will create the vpn_agent.ini file, in case it is needed for tests.

Minor changes are made to the post-test_hook.sh to indicate the location for
the Neutron and VPN repos.

Lastly, tox.ini is modified to place the rootwrap related files into the
virtual environment, copy in the VPN rootwrap filter, set up the rootwrap
commands, and copy the (customized) rootwrap.conf to /etc/neutron.

This last step is needed, because the neutron-vpn-netns-wrapper script that
is (currently) used for StrongSwan, uses /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf and
doesn't allow overriding. This copying is a simple approach that will work
when multiple functional jobs are running, as the same config is used.

As a future follow-up commit, we could look into modifying the VPN device
drivers to pass the full path to the rootwrap.conf as a argument to the
neutron-vpn-netns-wrapper script (--rootwrap_config). The setting could
be added to the vpnagent.ini config file, available via config, to allow
this to be customized to something other than /etc/neutron (for production
use), and the functional tests could override it to point to the right
virtual environment.

To configure the environment for local run of the functional test, one
can do:
    tools/configure_for_vpn_func_testing.sh <devstack-repo> [-i]

where:
   devstack-repo... Path to devstack repo (/opt/stack/new/devstack
                    when run by gate)
   -i.............. Indicates to install Neutron package dependencies

For StrongSwan, prefix the command with VENV=dsvm-functional-sswan

Ref: [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/176064/

Change-Id: I2243b06b3cdbb352dac7bc47d03c830efb87be3c
Closes-Bug: #1445052
Depends-On: Ie490e89c1a65e126ad0a57d062076e472762837e
"}]
commit_message:
VPNaaS: Revise functional test hooks

This commit does several things to allow functional tests to run, using a
DevStack configuration, but without stacking.

First, the gate_hook.sh is modified to specified environment variables
needed for processing, and will call configure_vpn_for_func_testing.sh.

The new configure_for_vpn_func_testing.sh script will first call the Neutron
configure_for_func_testing.sh script (as modified in [1]) to setup DevStack.
The script then installs the IPSec package, based on the functional job, and
will create the vpn_agent.ini file, in case it is needed for tests.

Minor changes are made to the post-test_hook.sh to indicate the location for
the Neutron and VPN repos.

Lastly, tox.ini is modified to place the rootwrap related files into the
virtual environment, copy in the VPN rootwrap filter, set up the rootwrap
commands, and copy the (customized) rootwrap.conf to /etc/neutron.

This last step is needed, because the neutron-vpn-netns-wrapper script that
is (currently) used for StrongSwan, uses /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf and
doesn't allow overriding. This copying is a simple approach that will work
when multiple functional jobs are running, as the same config is used.

As a future follow-up commit, we could look into modifying the VPN device
drivers to pass the full path to the rootwrap.conf as a argument to the
neutron-vpn-netns-wrapper script (--rootwrap_config). The setting could
be added to the vpnagent.ini config file, available via config, to allow
this to be customized to something other than /etc/neutron (for production
use), and the functional tests could override it to point to the right
virtual environment.

To configure the environment for local run of the functional test, one
can do:
    tools/configure_for_vpn_func_testing.sh <devstack-repo> [-i]

where:
   devstack-repo... Path to devstack repo (/opt/stack/new/devstack
                    when run by gate)
   -i.............. Indicates to install Neutron package dependencies

For StrongSwan, prefix the command with VENV=dsvm-functional-sswan

Ref: [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/176064/

Change-Id: I2243b06b3cdbb352dac7bc47d03c830efb87be3c
Closes-Bug: #1445052
Depends-On: Ie490e89c1a65e126ad0a57d062076e472762837e
